title: Principal
description: This model represents a principal in an access control system. Principals are entities that have been authenticated against an identity provider.

principalId.description: A unique (uniqueness is defined on the same lines as defined [here](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8141#section-5)) and persistent identifier for the principal. Ideally, this identifier should be a [URI](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986).

principalType.description: The type of the principal. Acts as a processing hint to the client. Principals can be of several types - user, group, organization, application, etcetra. The list is not necessarily finite. Ideally, each value should be identified as a [URI](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986).
